headline: Carvana, Comfort Systems, CRH To Join S&P 500 Index. The Stocks Are Jumping.
summary: Carvana, Comfort Systems and CRH jumped on news they'll join the S&P 500 index before the open on Dec. 22. Vertiv and SoFi are notable snubs.

raw.headline: Carvana, Comfort Systems, CRH To Join S&P 500 Index. The Stocks Are Jumping.

headline: Carvana, CRH, Comfort Systems to join S&P 500 in rebalancing
summary: The companies will join the benchmark in a quarterly rebalance at the end of December, S&P Dow Jones Indices said Friday.

raw.headline: Carvana, CRH, Comfort Systems to join S&P 500 in rebalancing
raw.summary: The companies will join the benchmark in a quarterly rebalance at the end of December, S&P Dow Jones Indices said Friday.

headline: Carvana, CRH, and Comfort Systems USA to Join S&P 500
summary: CRH Carvana  and  Comfort Systems USA  will join the S&P 500 as part of the benchmark index’s quarterly rebalancing, said S&P Dow Jones Indices after Friday’s market close.  LKQ Solstice Advanced Materials  and  Mohawk Industries  —companies with some of the smallest market values in the S&P 500—will be removed from the large-cap S&P 500 and demoted to the S&P 600 small-cap benchmark.  The S&P 500 index is rebalanced each quarter, with new companies added if they meet the criteria of S&P Dow Jones Indices, which oversees the index.

raw.headline: Carvana, CRH, and Comfort Systems USA to Join S&P 500
raw.summary: CRH Carvana  and  Comfort Systems USA  will join the S&P 500 as part of the benchmark index’s quarterly rebalancing, said S&P Dow Jones Indices after Friday’s market close.  LKQ Solstice Advanced Materials  and  Mohawk Industries  —companies with some of the smallest market values in the S&P 500—will be removed from the large-cap S&P 500 and demoted to the S&P 600 small-cap benchmark.  The S&P 500 index is rebalanced each quarter, with new companies added if they meet the criteria of S&P Dow Jones Indices, which oversees the index.

headline: CRH, Carvana and Comfort Systems USA Set to Join S&P 500; Others to Join S&P MidCap 400 and S&P SmallCap 600
summary: S&P Dow Jones Indices ("S&P DJI") will make the following changes to the S&P 500, S&P MidCap 400, and S&P SmallCap 600 indices effective prior to the open of trading on Monday, December 22, to coincide with the quarterly rebalance. The changes ensure that each index is more representative of its market capitalization range. The companies being removed from the S&P SmallCap 600 are no longer representative of the small-cap market space.

The changes ensure that each index is more representative of its market capitalization range.
